intro: Camissonia guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupe's camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The flowers are typically pink or purple, and they bloom in early spring. Camissonia guadalupensis is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, adapting well to arid and semi-arid environments.
